body: Paradigm: Multi-paradigm: event-driven, functional, imperative, prototype-based
Concurrency: Event loop model with support for asynchronous programming using callbacks, promises, and async/await
JavaScript Info.description: Provides general information about the JavaScript programming language.

body: JavaScript is a dynamically typed language. It does not have static types.
- Number: for both integers and floating-point numbers
JavaScript Types.description: Explains that JavaScript is dynamically typed and lists its built-in types.

JavaScript Date Type.description: JavaScript uses the Date object for date and time operations.

JavaScript List Type.description: The JavaScript array type, commonly used as a list.

JavaScript Date Now.description: Gets the current date and time in JavaScript.

body: // There is no specific syntax for declaring a variable with a dynamic type in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Variable.description: Creates a variable in JavaScript using the let keyword.

body: let ${1:myVar} = $2; // Note: JavaScript is dynamically typed.

JavaScript Create Nullable Variable.description: Creates a nullable variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create String Variable.description: Creates a string variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Multi-Line String Vari.description: Creates a multi-line string variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Number Variable.description: Creates a number variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Boolean Variable.description: Creates a boolean variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Date Variable.description: Creates a date variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Array Variable.description: Creates an array (list) variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Map Variable (Object).description: Creates an object variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Map Variable.description: Creates a map variable in JavaScript.

JavaScript Create Constant.description: Creates a constant variable in JavaScript using the const keyword.

JavaScript Static Variable.description: Creates a static variable in a JavaScript class.

JavaScript Generate Object Map.description: Generates an object map with a specific number of key-value pairs in JavaScript.

JavaScript Generate Array.description: Generates an array (list) of a specific length in JavaScript.

JavaScript Print.description: Prints a message to the console in JavaScript.

JavaScript Print Multi.description: Prints a multi-line message to the console in JavaScript.

JavaScript For Loop.description: Creates a for loop that iterates through a set of numbers with the index in JavaScript.

JavaScript For...Of Loop.description: Iterates over an iterable object in JavaScript.

JavaScript While Loop.description: Creates a while loop in JavaScript.

JavaScript Switch Statement.description: Creates a switch statement in JavaScript.

body: // In JavaScript, functions can have arguments with default values.
JavaScript Function Args.description: Creates a function with arguments in JavaScript, including an argument with a default value.

JavaScript Function Named Args.description: Creates a function with named arguments in JavaScript using object destructuring.

body: // Function with arguments: function functionName(arg1, arg2, ...) { ... }
// Function with named arguments (using object destructuring): function functionName({arg1, arg2, ...}) { ... }
JavaScript Function Syntax.description: Outlines the syntax for functions in JavaScript.

JavaScript Comment.description: Creates a single-line comment in JavaScript.

JavaScript Multi-Line Comment.description: Creates a multi-line comment in JavaScript.

JavaScript Try Catch.description: Creates a try...catch block in JavaScript.

JavaScript If Statement.description: Creates an if statement in JavaScript.

JavaScript If Else Statement.description: Creates an if...else statement in JavaScript.

JavaScript Ternary Operator.description: Creates a ternary operator in JavaScript.

JavaScript Lambda.description: Creates a lambda function in JavaScript.
